did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle:
Nevada Folklife Archive
1980-2017
did.physdesc: 9,805 photographs : film negatives, black and white ; 35 mm
413 photographs : contact sheets, black and white ; various sizes

corpname.part: American Folklife Center, Library of Congress

did.abstract: This collection consists of photographs, recordings, and field notes documenting diverse culture, traditions, and communities in Nevada. Sponsored by the Nevada Arts Council Folklife Program, collection materials were collected by staff folklorists beginning in 1985.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: Nevada Arts Council, Folklife Program; 2016 and 2022.

processinfo.head: Processing History
processinfo.p: The Nevada Folklife Archive was processed by Ann Hoog in 2019 and by Sara Ludewig and Carolina Restrepo in 2022.

The American Folklife Center received digital files from the Nevada Folklife Archive collection on two hard drives, each of which was assigned a unique digital ID number. Sara Ludewig rearranged the files from their original order into format series and subseries that mirror the physical material's arrangement. The archivist assigned files to an AIP by series and the AIP for each series was assigned a new name. The AIP for Series 3 was divided into two parts to accommodate file size limits. Each file retained its individual file name. See the arrangement notes for each specific subseries for more information about the arrangement and description of digital files in this collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright Status
userestrict.p: Duplication of collection materials may be governed by copyright and other restrictions.

accessrestrict.head: Access and Restrictions
accessrestrict.p:
The Nevada Folklife Archive is open to research. To request materials, please contact the Folklife Reading Room at
https://hdl.loc.gov/loc.afc/folklife.contact
Certain restrictions to use or copying of materials may apply.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: [item, date, container number], Nevada Folklife Archive (AFC 2017/002), American Folklife Center, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

bioghist.head: Administrative History
bioghist.p: The Nevada Arts Council Folklife Program, a division of the Nevada Department of Tourism and Cultural Affairs, was founded in 1985. The organization administers grants, produces exhibits and publications, and initiates documentation projects that focus on the many forms of individual, organizational, and community folklife across the state of Nevada. The Nevada Folklife Archive existed as a repository for the fieldwork conducted by folklorists and contractors employed by the agency beginning in 1985. Folklorists employed by the Nevada Arts Council Folklife Program include Andrea Graham, Russell Frank, Blanton Owen, Eliza Buck, Jeanne Harrah Johnson, Anne F. Hatch, Michael Luster, Lesley Williams, Nicholas Curchin Vrooman, Tamara Layman, Debbie Nolan, Penny Rucks, and Christina Barr, among others.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Nevada Folklife Archive spans the years 1980 to 2017. The collection consists of field work conducted by folklorists employed by the Nevada Arts Council Folklife Program to document diverse communities and traditions across the state of Nevada.

Tasked with documenting various aspects of life and culture in Nevada, folklorists employed by the Nevada Arts Council Folklife Program collected the extensive sound recordings, photographs, transcripts, and field notes retained in this collection. The collection includes documentation of occupational folklife, including ranching, mining, railroad work, nuclear plants, and the entertainment industry; expressive traditions, including fiddling contests, cowboy poetry, leatherwork, glassblowing, basketry, quilting, music, and dance; and examples of vernacular architecture on ranches. Interviews and documentation highlight African American, Mormon, Paiute, Shoshone, Basque, Latinx, Japanese American, Thai American, South Asian American, Scottish American, and Italian American communities and traditions across Nevada. A large portion of the collection also documents programs and events sponsored by the Nevada Arts Council Folklife Program, including the Las Vegas Folklife Festival, the Sierra Folklife Festival, and the Folk Arts Apprenticeship. In addition to field work documentation, the collection includes correspondence relating to the administration of the Folklife Program, publications from the Folklife Program, and program files relating to the production of the Las Vegas Folklife Festival and the Sierra Folklife Festival.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The Nevada Folklife Archive is organized in 3 series:

Digital materials are arranged into AIPs to mirror the arrangement of analog materials in the collection. Collection materials were accompanied by a metadata spreadsheet provided by the donor. Researchers may wish to consult this spreadsheet to find more detailed, item level description of both analog and digital materials in the collection. See NFA Spreadsheet.xlsx

controlaccess.head: Selected Search Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the LC Catalog. They are grouped by name of person or organization, by subject or location, and by occupation and listed alphabetically.

did.unittitle: Series 1: Manuscript materials
Subseries 1: Field notes

processinfo.p:
Processing history:
The archivist rearranged digital files from their original order and grouped files together by type and by subseries within a series-level AIP. Both digitized and born-digital materials are available in afc2017002_series1.

scopecontent.p:
Scope and content:
Field notes collected by folklorists documenting Nevada folklife in a variety of projects and surveys, including the Folklife Apprenticeship Program, the Lander County Survey, the Douglas County Survey, the Reno Folk Arts Survey, and the Las Vegas Folk Arts Survey.

arrangement.p:
Arrangement:
This subseries is arranged by the original Item ID number provided by the donor. The archivist retained folder headings provided by the donor and copied from documentation provided by the donor to create any additional description found in the finding aid. Description linking field notes to their associated audio and visual content has been provided wherever possible. This subseries contains both born digital and digitized files.

Subseries 6: Interview transcripts

processinfo.p:
Processing history:
The transcripts in this subseries are associated with audio recordings that are not included as part of this collection. The archivist paired transcripts of audio recordings that are contained in the collection with their associated audio recordings wherever possible. These transcripts are described alongside their associated audio recording in
Series 2, Subseries 1
. The archivist rearranged digital files from their original order and grouped files together by subseries and chronologically therein within their series-level AIP.

Series 2: Sound recordings

scopecontent.p:
Scope and content:
Sound recordings on cassette tapes and audio reels of interviews, music, and events.

did.unittitle: Subseries 1: Audiocassettes

arrangement.p:
Arrangement:
This subseries is arranged by the original Item ID number provided by the donor. The archivist linked cassette copies of audio to their original reel wherever possible. She also paired transcripts with their associated audio recordings wherever possible. The archivist copied directly from documentation provided by the donor to provide the title for each cassette and she described cassette tapes using donor documentation, not by listening to the tapes. As a result, errors and discrepancies may exist.

Subseries 1: Slides

processinfo.p:
Processing history:
The archivist rearranged digital files from their original order and grouped digitized slides together in by subseries within a series-level AIP. Series 3 was split into two AIPs due to limits on file size. The donor digitized slides in this subseries, these materials are available to access at: afc2017002_series3_part1\Subseries 1, digitized slides, 1986-1990 and afc2017002_series3_part2\Subseries 1, digitized slides, 1991-2005. The Item ID for each digital file corresponds to the Item ID numbers for the analog materials. Each digitized slide is available as both a .jpg and a .tif.

scopecontent.p:
Scope and content:
Color slides of events, art, performances, vernacular architecture, and occupational folklife. The slides also document material from the Folklife Apprenticeship as well as various folklife festivals across Nevada. Note that the following slide groupings are missing: S-2000-011 through S-2000-019, S-2002-039, S-2002-061 through S-2002-074, S-2003-001 through S-2003-024, S-2003-042 through S-2003-049; S-2003-072 through S-2003-100, and S-2004-021 through S-2004-050.

arrangement.p:
Arrangement:
This subseries is arranged by the original Item ID number provided by the donor. Slides are described in groupings based on documentation provided by the donor. In some cases, slides within a grouping are described at the item level. For further item level description of slides see
Slide Logs
.

Subseries 2: Negatives

processinfo.p:
Processing history:
The archivist rearranged digital files from their original order and grouped digitized negatives together in a subseries within their series-level AIP. The donor digitized a portion of the negatives in this subseries, these materials are available to access at: afc2017002_series3_part1\Subseries 2, digitized negatives. The Item ID for each digital file corresponds to the Item ID numbers for the analog materials. Each digitized negative is available as both a .jpg and a .tif.

scopecontent.p:
Scope and content:
Black-and-white negatives of events, art, performances, vernacular architecture, and occupational folklife. Negatives also document the Folklife Apprenticeship Program and various folklife festivals across Nevada.

arrangement.p:
Arrangement:
This subseries is arranged by the original Item ID number provided by the donor. Negatives are described in groupings based on documentation provided by the donor. In some cases, negatives within a grouping are described at the item level. For further item level description of negatives see
Photo Logs
.

Subseries 3: Prints

processinfo.p:
Processing history:
The archivist rearranged digital files from their original order and grouped digitized contact sheets together in a subseries within a series-level AIP. The donor digitized a portion of the contact sheets in this subseries, these materials are available to access at: afc2017002_series3_part1\Subseries 3, digitized contact sheets. The Item ID for each digital file corresponds to the Item ID numbers for the analog materials. Each digitized contact sheet is available as both a .jpg and a .tif.

scopecontent.p:
Scope and content:
Black-and-white contact sheets from negatives. Also includes color prints of a quilting retreat with no associated negatives.

arrangement.p:
Arrangement:
This subseries is arranged chronologically. Contact sheets have been linked to their original negatives wherever possible.

Subseries 4: Born-digital photographs

processinfo.p:
Processing history:
The archivist arranged and described born-digital photographs in groupings based on documentation provided by the donor. Each grouping contains two .jpg copies of each image.

scopecontent.p:
Scope and content:
Digital photographs from the beginning of the Nevada Folklife Archive's transition from analog to digital photography.

arrangement.p:
Arrangement:
This subseries is arranged by the original Item ID number provided by the donor.
